Re Class Registrationpickle at all I have your email AND will you please register tonight sometime between pm and midnight open hours Or at the latest am on Monday morning TJ At PM you wrote Greetings TJ Well Im in a pickle The memo you sent said we had from AM to PM on and from AM to AM on But the documentation I received from Telebears said from PM on to PM on All that aside I have obviously missed the times its my fault and I apologize I spoke with Diane this morning and she suggested that I throw myself at the mercy of the court by writing you an email with my picks Here they are Class Control My Priority Units Competitive Strategy Negotiations NonProfit Boards Financial Institutions and Markets Leadership and Change Id like to take units unit classes and the unit class Sorry for the mixup Thanks very much for you help If you have any questions dont hesitate to contact me at Best Jeff

Re oneunit courses for Fall saw that you signed up on Telebears for NonProfits and we downloaded those requests too So youre all set TJ At AM you wrote Hi TJ Work has prevented me from being on campus this week I registered for unit courses but have not signed up in the office If that is mandatory please let me know and my girlfrienda student in the day program who will be there todaycan sign me up Best Jeff Teresa Janus aasBerkeleyEDU To Sent by cc owner aasBe Subject oneunit courses for Fall rkeleyEDU PM Please respond to Teresa Janus Hi ONEUNIT COURSES The demand for oneunit courses is very high as outlined in the Student Handbook It is uncommon for a student to be given a space in more than ONE oneunit course per semester If you got into your st choice of a unit class for Fall you will not be put on a waitlist for your nd choice at this time After classes start in the Fall if there is room available in any of the units well let you know Adds will be based on seniority in the program Thanks Youll be given a chance to update your schedules May May I will email your Fall schedules to you this Friday Thanks TJ

Registration for Spring Round IEveryone Attached you will find your Spring schedule as of Round I For those of you taking elective classes Round II is another opportunity to make adjustments to your schedule Please note the following To make any adjustments to your schedule you must email me with the changes youd like to make In your email please include which courses you want to add or drop how many oneunit courses you would like to have and the total number of units you want for the Spring semester The deadline to make adjustments to your schedule in Round II is Monday November at noon The next opportunity you will have to make schedule changes will be through the adddrop process with me in January during the first week of classes If you got into more than one oneunit course and there is a meeting time conflict please email me which of the two oneunit courses you prefer to take If you are interested in enrolling in day classes you may do so by emailing me which course you would like take Your name will go on a list and during the first week of classes I will find out the availability of seats in that class I will then let you know whether you got into the class Remember Round II of preregistration is done via email to me not via TeleBEARS Thanks TJ FinalSchedulehtml

Registration for Spring Round IIEveryone Attached please find your Spring schedule as of Round II To make any adjustments to your schedule please come by the Evening MBA office in January first week of classes to fill out an adddrop form Do not go into Telebears Please doublecheck that there are no time conflicts especially with the oneunit courses You must let us know by Friday December if you plan to drop any of your oneunit courses You will not be able to drop a oneunit class after December and you will be responsible for the readers and textbooks If you are interested in taking day classes please let me know by email Ill put your name on a list During the first weeks of classes Ill confirm the availability of seats Thanks TJ FinalSchedulehtml
EJeff You are now registered in E Financial Information Analysis Please come in and pick up any booksreaders for the course Thanks TJ

EB Speaking for Management Cc This is from Bill Sonnenschein the instructor for EB Speaking for Management Hello all And welcome in advance I want to pass on some information to you to prepare you for the first class session Class will meet on February from am to pm The time is very short for a speech course I am asking you to prepare a little before the first session to assure you get as much as you can out of the course Please come to the first day of class with a prepared persuasive speech a speech that moves the audience to action The speech should be three to five minutes in length and on a topic you feel very strongly about I do not care if the topic concerns business It could be political social moral or even spiritual The most important thing is that you believe strongly in the message Leaders must learn to speak from the heart The focus of the course will be on speaking in a business context but it is important to speak with feeling first and learn to transfer that skill to a business context I do not care if you write the speech out or create an outline and rehearse giving the speech extemporaneously The idea is to be prepared I will talk about delivering from a manuscript as well as the advantages of extemporaneous speaking as part of one lecture You may also want to buy a blank video tape You will not need it till the second Saturday and even then using it will be optional Videotaping speeches is an excellent learning tool but can be counterproductive if students get too nervous doing it I never use tape the first class session and you choose if you want to be taped the second session If you have any questions please feel free to call me at or email me at Thanks I am looking forward to working with you Bill William Sonnenschein Communications Group Faculty Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Office or Home

st class assignmentsNonPrivilegedpst Hi Evening MBA Students I wanted to give you an update on First Class Assignments for classes that begin next week See you TJ E Finance The class has its own web page The URL is berkteachingEEhtml You will find the class syllabus outline on the web page Note that there is a reading assignment for the first lecture Professor Berk said that if you dont have chance to come in to get the book before next week thats okay Just take a look at his syllabus and then refer to the lecture notes and drafts from the book hes working on E Competitive Strategy None assigned as of E Corporate Financial Reporting Please read pages and in the reader E Financial Institutions Markets None assigned as of E Corporate Finance Reading assignment RWJ Chapter Reading assignment RWJ Chapter E Derivatives None assigned as of E Negotiations None assigned as of E Global Management Please read the first article in the reader Hofstede and the first three chapters of the book Trompenaars E High Tech Marketing None assigned as of E Branding Please read Chapter from each of the following texts Strategic Brand Management by Keller and Brand Leadership by Aaker and Joachimsthaler E Deals Please read the introduction to the Masten book E Real Estate Financing None assigned as of EB Speaking for Management Sent to you with BacktoSchool packet If you dont have it please call Josh at and we can fax it to you EB Diversity Management None assigned as of E Entrepreneurship None assigned as of E NonProfit Boards None assigned as of E Business Law from Managers the Legal Environment chapter Ethics the Law Question chapter Constitutional Bases for Business Regulation Questions chapter Consumer Protection Questions E Technology Sector Literacy None assigned as of E EBusiness Supply Chain Management Afuah and Tucci Chapters A Managers Primer in Electronic Commerce by A Urbaczewski LM Jessup and BC Wheeler Business Horizons SeptemberOctober New Supply Chain Business Models The Opportunities and Challenges by DL Anderson and HL Lee ASCET May documentsaspd ID E New Telecom Ventures None assigned as of E Pricing Strategy Analysis Sent to you with BacktoSchool packet If you dont have it please call Josh at and we can fax it to you

Haas Alumni Network Online Community presentationsDear Evening MBA students We enjoyed providing you with an overview of the Haas Alumni Network and our online services at our pizza presentations in midNovember Some of you were unable to attend our session because your class was not held on that Thursday night and we tried to find a suitable classroompresentation space for a session this week but there is nothing available during your pm break So we have decided that we will hold more information sessions about the Haas Alumni Network next semester in order to accommodate your needs In the meantime if you have any questions please consult the Haas Alumni Network brochure you received in your mailbox earlier this semester visit our website for detailed overviews and updates or contact my office at for assistance with registration to the Online Community Good luck with your final projects and exams Tenny Frost Director Alumni Relations Be in CalBusiness submit an update on your career and personal life alumninotes Tenny H Frost Director of Alumni Relations Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley S Student Services Building Berkeley CA USA Alumni Relations Office direct line fax alumni

Conference Discount for Evening MBAs Cc NonPrivilegedpst Dear Evening MBA Students The Center for Financial Reporting and Management in the Haas School is hosting a conference Business Combinations and GoodwillWhat the New FASB Rulings Mean to You on Friday Sept at the San Francisco Airport Marriott Hotel As a special offer to Evening MBA Program students we are offering one seat to each student at the discounted price of per seat This can be used by you or by a person in your firm whom you wish to designate A copy of the program is attached If you or an associate wish to attend please register online at accountingcfrmregistrationhtm When filling out the registration form please write EVENING PROGRAM in the additional registrants space on the form Dayna will contact you regarding payment after August when she returns from vacation If you prefer to pay by check you may print the registration form and mail it or leave it in Dayna Haughs mailbox in the student services building mailroom with a check If you have questions you can contact Dayna Haugh at Dayna Haugh Assistant Director Center for Financial Reporting and Management Haas School of Business University of California D Faculty Building Berkeley CA Phone Fax accountingcfrmcfrmhtm

Spring classes begin Tuesday January NonPrivilegedpst Hi Spring Semester classes begin on Tuesday January There was an error for the month of January on the Fall Evening MBA Calendar and Im attaching a corrected version Thanks TJ

Health Insurance Waiver creditsNonPrivilegedpst Hi Evening MBA students The University Health Services Office just informed us that the Health Insurance Waiver credits will be reflected on September billing statements So if you submitted a health insurance waiver on time you dont have to pay the that you see on your August statement and you wont be charged a late fee because of it Thanks TJ

Fwd final incident report Oct suspicious substanceMonday October To The Haas School Community From Pete Dietrich MD MPH Medical Director University Health Services On October a specimen of powder was collected from the mail processing area of the Haas School of Business and sent to the California Department of Health Services laboratory for testing The final results of the testing done on this powder revealed no evidence of any harmful substance As a result we conclude that there is no health concern whatsoever and specifically no anthrax spores were detected As with most unknown materials submitted for analysis the actual identity of the material may never be definitively determined The recent events around the country have generated a lot of understandable anxiety but to date there have been no confirmed cases of anthrax in the State of California As with this incident strong teamwork continued vigilance tempered with common sense will be important as we face the challenges of the future If you have any questions you may contact Environment Health Safety University Health Services Additional information is available at the University Health Services web site at www uhsberkeleyedu

RE Welcome BackNonPrivilegedpst Hi Jeff Im looking at your transcript and youve already completed units Youre taking units this semester for a total of units You need units to graduate You may want to consider adding a unit this semester Or next semester units will cost about half or more units full price Just let me know if you want to add another class but you may not have the time Just ask at our front desk and well make you a copy of your latest transcript You can go to the Deals class tonight even though youre on the waiting list Ill update the status on Friday You may want to have a backup See you TJ At AM you wrote Greetings Thanks for the welcome back Couple things how many units do I need to graduate where can I go other than scrounge up the pieces of paper I receive in the mail at the end of every semester to find out how many units Ive thus far accumulated Finally I notice that you mentioned that Shelanskys class is full up even the waiting the list Would I be ejected from the program if I nonetheless tried to get in Look forward to seeing you soon Best Jeff Original Message From Teresa Janus mailto aasBerkeleyEDU Sent Wednesday August PM To Subject Welcome Back Hi Evening MBA Students Welcome back to school Here are a few updates regarding the Fall semester Continuing Students Classes begin the week of Monday August Confirmed Class Schedule Please come by the Evening MBA office on the first night of classes to review your confirmed class schedule Wed also like you to fill out an Address Update Form with current information on employer and other contact information Whether you have updates or not please come by the office and sign the form so we will be able to include your information in the Fall student address directory Waitlists If you are on a waitlist for any course Ill update the waitlist status each Friday afternoon Ill let you know by email as soon as you are officially enrolled and will let you know when to pick up the textbooksreaders AddDrops If you plan to add or drop any courses please come into the office and fill out an adddrop form when classes begin If you are dropping a course and you received books andor readers for the course please return them with the form This is required Well order books for you when you add a class Please note that we are unable to return reading packets for credit so if you drop a course we will try to find another student who wants to add the course and needs the reader However if no other student is adding the course you will be responsible for reimbursing us for the cost of the reader Day Classes If you are interested in taking day classes a list of Fall day electives will be available in the Evening MBA office when classes begin Please let me know the course number and title by email Course descriptions for day classes can be found at Coursescourseshtml If space is available in a day class the fulltime MBA Program staff will add you manually to the course Please dont add through Telebears During the first three weeks of classes Ill confirm the availability of seats by email on Fridays Please note that BA units cannot be used toward your MBA degree requirements Textbooks and Readers You may pick up textbooks and readingcase packets by coming to the Evening MBA Program office We are open MondayThursday am pm and Friday am pm Textbooks and readers will also be available to you the first week of classes MondayThursday pm and during your break in room F Health Insurance Waivers The deadline to submit your waiver was July and a credit will show up on your next statement if you submitted a form on time Please call University Health Services at if you have any questions or to see if it is possible to submit a late form Shuttle Buses The shuttle pickup times will remain the same as last semester pm The South Bay Shuttle pickup location remains the same at Our Ladys Way not S Inc parking lot Parking To obtain your parking permits and passes we ask that you come by the office to pick up your permit and passes or drive to the Kleeberger Field Lot where one of the student workers will have your permit and passes ready for you to pick up from pm during the first week of classes Before and after the first week you may pick up your passes from the office Writing Requirement The last day for Fall students to submit writing samples for the Writing Requirement is Monday September Students who have not fulfilled their writing requirements will not be able to preroll in Spring courses Course Updates E High Tech Marketing first class meets Saturday August am noon at Intel directions emailed to registered students E Taxes Firm Strategy Suneel Udpa has been cancelled New Class E Technology Sector Literacy Sarah Tasker units Tuesdays pm pm ABSTRACT This course is a beta test of a new course under development The new course will be aimed exclusively at students with zero technical background and will provide an overview of the technologies and companies that comprise the IT information technology industry Enrollment in Fall is by permission of the instructor only Interested students should contact Sarah Tasker at and cc See Coursescourseshtml Current Evening MBA Students Website Please check out our website at EvMBA where youll find information on courses financial aid the Back to School Packet Health Insurance Waivers Majordomo the Student Directory Bear Facts and TeleBEARS We look forward to seeing you TJ This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you

EB Speaking for Management Cc This is from Bill Sonnenschein the instructor for EB Speaking for Management Hello all And welcome in advance I want to pass on some information to you to prepare you for the first class session Class will meet on February from am to pm The time is very short for a speech course I am asking you to prepare a little before the first session to assure you get as much as you can out of the course Please come to the first day of class with a prepared persuasive speech a speech that moves the audience to action The speech should be three to five minutes in length and on a topic you feel very strongly about I do not care if the topic concerns business It could be political social moral or even spiritual The most important thing is that you believe strongly in the message Leaders must learn to speak from the heart The focus of the course will be on speaking in a business context but it is important to speak with feeling first and learn to transfer that skill to a business context I do not care if you write the speech out or create an outline and rehearse giving the speech extemporaneously The idea is to be prepared I will talk about delivering from a manuscript as well as the advantages of extemporaneous speaking as part of one lecture You may also want to buy a blank video tape You will not need it till the second Saturday and even then using it will be optional Videotaping speeches is an excellent learning tool but can be counterproductive if students get too nervous doing it I never use tape the first class session and you choose if you want to be taped the second session If you have any questions please feel free to call me at or email me at Thanks I am looking forward to working with you Bill William Sonnenschein Communications Group Faculty Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley Office or Home
